facebook.title: Forest fires: Burn out
facebook.summary:
Forest Fires:
Fire needs fuel, oxygen, and heat to survive. In forests, the fuel is provided by trees and bushes. In houses and buildings, the fuel is wood, furniture, books, and papers. Oxygen is not hard to find, seeing as it is all around us in the

facebook.title: Forest fires: Burn out

facebook.title: Forest fires: Burn out
facebook.summary: As if we didn't know. . . tough times for the forests.

facebook.title: Forest fires: Burn out
facebook.summary:
We cover fire in Chapters 9 and 10 of our book. Plants are remarkably well adapted to fire in some regions of the world, but it seems that in the American west the recent fires may be too much.
http://www.nature.com/news/forest-fires-burn-out-1.11424

facebook.title: Forest fires: Burn out
facebook.summary: As one of the hottest summers ever comes to an end, it is worth reflecting on the causes and effects of unprecedented drought and wildfires. This could be another example of the new normal of climate change.

facebook.title: Forest fires: Burn out

-FOREST FIRES: BURN OUT
Nature News - 19 September 2012
